poem:
**The Shape of Votes**

In France, a sea of ballots
drifts toward a second round,
as ink-stained fingers lift democracy
from cafes and narrow streets,
casting futures into the pooling dusk.
Yet in the quiet of turnout,
it's the unheard whispers
that etch history
on the parchment of night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "French parliamentary elections – what to look out for and when Voting in the first round of parliamentary elections is under way in mainland France. The last polling stations close at 8pm local time on Sunday. Elections for the 577 seats in France’s national assembly are a two-round process. The shape of the new parliament will become clear only after the second round on 7 July. Turnout The turnout at 5pm CET in mainland France". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: French parliamentary elections – what to look out for and when Voting in the first round of parliamentary elections is under way in mainland France. The last polling stations close at 8pm local time on Sunday. Elections for the 577 seats in France’s national assembly are a two-round process. The shape of the new parliament will become clear only after the second round on 7 July. Turnout The turnout at 5pm CET in mainland France
